name: Eld's Deer
description: This tropical deer is named for its antlers, which are found only on males, and their unique lyre-shaped form.
spread_note: Isolated populations in central Myanmar, introduced in Thailand
food_note: Mainly grass, occasionally flowers, leaves, and fruits
proportions: Body length 1–1.7 m, tail length 22–25 cm, shoulder height 1.1–1.3 m, weight 95–150 kg
attractions: Eld's Deer lives in female groups with males joining during rut. It is nocturnal and secretive, being very shy.
projects_note: Listed as an endangered species on the IUCN Red List. The main threat is hunting for meat, trophies, and body parts used in traditional medicine. Habitat loss is another major threat.
breeding: The first Eld's Deer arrived in Prague in 1985, and more than 40 calves have been born since.
